intro: Chaetogastra tortuosa, commonly known as the twisted hair grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, spikelet-based flowers. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in moist, sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and botanical collections.
